definition: (onom.) sound of object falling into water/plop
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc

sentences.english: For a few seconds heart plop plop jumped.
sentences.chinese: 對看沒幾秒心就撲通撲通的跳了。

sentences.english: For a few seconds heart plop plop jumped.
sentences.chinese: 對看沒幾秒心就撲通撲通的跳了。

sentences.english: Ralph, Jr. plops down on couch and sighs with satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 小拉爾夫撲通一聲坐在沙發椅上，滿意地嘆了口氣。

sentences.english: He dived into the water with a splash.
sentences.chinese: 撲通一聲，他扎進水裏去了。

sentences.english: You thanked her by plopping into the nearest pile of mud.
sentences.chinese: 你報答她，撲通一聲摔進旁邊一堆泥巴里。

sentences.english: Wellhung: I'm taking the sopping wet blouse from you. I drop it with a plop.
sentences.chinese: 我把浸透黏液的上衣接過來，撲通一聲扔到地上。

sentences.english: Splash! A big-eyed, bulging bullfrog plops into a pond.
sentences.chinese: “撲通”，一隻眼睛又大又突的牛蛙跳進池塘裏。
有些令人失望地“撲通”的掉下去了。

sentences.english: He plops behind the desk, yawns and rubs his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他撲通一聲跌坐在辦公桌前，又打呵欠又擦眼睛的。

sentences.english: But he became a star with the movie "Splash" in nineteen eighty-four.
sentences.chinese: 但他成爲了與電影“撲通”星級一九八四年。

sentences.english: I just stand up, ' "splash" heard, sat on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 我剛站起來，‘“撲通”一聲，就坐在了地上。

sentences.english: He fell into the water with a splash.
The box fell plonk on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 盒子撲通一聲掉在地上。

sentences.english: He leapt headlong into the river.

definition: to jump about/(of the heart) to beat wildly
to cry out in fear
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
to feel numb
limp/weak
immediately/at once
to scream/blood-curdling screech/miserable shriek
variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
to tremble/to shake/to shiver
audible
to collapse (from dehydration or loss of blood)/heat exhaustion
to get out of the way
to beg forgiveness
to shiver
twice/for a little while
to lean unsteadily from side to side (idiom)/to sway/(of buildings etc) to lean at a crazy angle
